PUBLIC "-//David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library//TEXT (US::NDD::::Josephine Humphreys Papers)//EN" "humphreysjosephine.xml" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.xsl (sy2003-10-15).

Also, the top level of the finding aid (above the dsc) changed to conform to current Rubenstein Library and NC EAD standards as laid out in the Inventory Style Guide and in the NCEAD Best Practice Guidelines. Within the dsc, dates for series were normalized. These changes were made by Michelle Belden.
Also, container TYPE and LABEL attribute values were standardized according to the Rubenstein Library EAD 2002 manual and the NCEAD eadlocal.ent by Ruth E. Bryan.
The tag list inside index was changed to indexentry by Ruth E. Bryan.

did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Josephine Humphreys Papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Josephine Humphreys Papers were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift, 1992-1996.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Rubenstein Library staff, Paula Jeannet, Alice Poffinberger, and Ruth E. Bryan
This collection is unprocessed: materials may not have been ordered and described beyond their original condition.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Author residing on Sullivan's Island (Charleston Co.), S.C.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The collection documents Humphreys' professional life as an author. It contains correspondence between Humphreys and other writers and editors; business contracts with Viking Press and others for her publications and for movie rights; handwritten and typed manuscripts and proofs for her books Dreams of Sleep, Rich in Love, and Fireman's Fair, as well as typescripts of works by other authors (including Robb Forman Dew and Louise Erdrich); reviews of her own work as well as reviews written by Humphreys of others' works; and information detailing her speaking engagements and interviews. In addition, the collection contains clippings of reviews and interviews, photographs and negatives (16 black-and-white, 4 color, and 23 negatives); audiotapes from a "Women in Literature" series in which Humphreys participated; and 10 electronic files of book manuscripts, especially Dreams of Sleep, originally on computer disks and now migrated to the electronic records server. Also included are books inscribed to Humphreys and seven scrapbooks containing additional correspondence regarding her work as well as reviews.

controlaccess.head: Subject Headings
controlaccess.p: These are searchable subject entries for this collection. Performing a search on these subjects in the Duke University Libraries online catalog will bring up other related research materials.

accessrestrict.p: Correspondence and business contracts in boxes 1 and 2 are restricted.

processinfo.p: Three original 8" floppy computer disks were removed from this accession, and their contents (6 electronic files of manuscript material, including Dreams of Sleep) were migrated to the Special Collections server. Contact the Reference Archivist on duty for access.

In addition, some of the materials in this collection are not immediately accessible, because they require further processing before use. See notes in boxes 1, 2, 3, 4, and 13. Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.
Attention: Technical Services staff need to remove materials from envelopes; flatten wrinkled paper; and reformat newspaper clippings.
